text: Fall asleep and enter Tribbie's dream

title: Mission Description
content: A dream carriesusback to memories long faded by time, and this dream mirrors the profound fears withinourhearts.

line: Momma, Momma! I had a dream last night.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Oh? Now, what did you dream about, my darling Tribios ?

speaker: Tribios
line: I had a dream that I turned into many mes! Then we made the moon into a ship and made the stars into our sails! Then we floated on the ocean and let the wind blow us in any direction it wanted!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Well that sounds like a lovely dream.

speaker: Tribios
line: Yeah! The ocean and the sky were really, really dark, but there were so many of me that I wasn't scared at all. Because we'd all sing together!

speaker: Tribios
line: The ocean wind blew us onto an island where the wind tasted like flowers. There were bleating sheep and chirping birds inviting us to be their guests. There were so many animals on the island, but none of them ever fought!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Janus ' Holy Maidens can receive guidance from the god of passages. Perhaps what you saw in your dream is a divine land somewhere in Amphoreus .

speaker: Tribios
line: Y—You think so?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: What's wrong, Tribios? You look unhappy.

speaker: Tribios
line: Because... on that same island, I saw a dark mountain on the other side of the ocean. And it was very, very tall.

speaker: Tribios
line: The mountain looked alive, and it kept getting closer to the island. Then I realized that it wasn't a mountain, but a very, very tall wave made of water... When the wave smashed against the island, it looked like it was going to eat the island up. The small animals tried to chase it away, but they couldn't stop it...

speaker: Tribios
line: Then there was a "bang!" and I woke up.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Hm... A dark wave...

speaker: Tribios
line: Momma, does something that scary exist in real life?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Yes... Unfortunately, it does exist in Amphoreus, but it's very far away from our temple.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: We call it the " black tide ," though it has nothing to do with water. It has no shape or form, but it can swallow up animals, humans, and even Titans ... turning them all into monsters.

speaker: Tribios
line: Ooh... The black tide is a baddie! I don't want everyone to turn into its food. Can't we chase it away?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Of course, my dear. You only need to behave well and listen to what the adults tell you, study all the knowledge and etiquette you need, then grow up and become a proper Holy Maiden...

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: The divine Janus will then give you guidance and help you light the way for the people.

speaker: Tribios
line: Wow! I'm gonna eat a lot and study a lot and become a Holy Maiden!

speaker: Tribios
line: But, Momma, you said the black tide can swallow up Titans too. What do we do if even Janus is eaten?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: If that happens... then the Holy Maiden will have to be the one to guide people on the right path. After all, we are the human avatars of the god of passages, yeah?

speaker: Tribios
line: Yeah!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Hehe. But one person alone is not enough. Once you're older, you'll make a lot of friends. You must do your best to unite them because that's also our duty as priests.

speaker: Tribios
line: Friends? Are they also like me and Momma, with pretty red hair?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: They might not, but they'll certainly be just as smart and kind as you.

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Mama...)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Am I... dreaming?)

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Don't be silly, dear. Of course you're not dreaming. I've always been by your side.

speaker: Tribbie
line: (What...)

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Now be a good girl and call your friends over too...

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Let's play hide-and-seek just like we used to, okay? My Tribios is the smartest girl. I'm sure you remember where everyone is hiding.

speaker: Tribbie
line: (The voice... sounds so far away.)

speaker: Tribbie
line: I don't... remember... Who am I looking for?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Your friends who will chase the black tide away alongside you, of course.

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Is this... from my childhood? I don't remember...)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (A blackboard? And what is that drawing...?)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (It doesn't ring a bell at all. Perhaps it's just a childhood doodle.)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (It's packed full... Mama must have left all of these for me.)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (All the words are blurred out... Could it be that my memory is fading?)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (I used to sit here and listen to Mama tell stories...)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Oh, how I wish to see you again... Mama.)
Use the spindle to connect everyone!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: There will be an amazing captain on that big ship. She's cheerful, optimistic, bold, and cautious. She'll be able to get everyone together.

speaker: Tribios
line: Wow, that's amazing! Can I be the captain?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Of course you can! But you'll find someone else who's better for the job, my dear.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: I think that person lives in a beautiful temple that sits atop a hillside covered in golden fig trees.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: There's a noble girl there who's very smart but also very delicate.

speaker: Tribios
line: Just like Momma...?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Perhaps. But before we find the captain, the ship also needs someone who can navigate it. Who could that be?

speaker: Tribios
line: Mmm... Let me think...

speaker: Tribios
line: I know! She's... "Tribbie"!

speaker: Tribbie
line: (I named this doll... after myself?)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (I don't remember at all... Is this a dream, or something that happened in the past?)
Bad chest, you can't lock me away!

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Huh? Why is this doll inside a chest...?)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (It's holding a... sword? Why...)

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Many years later, many brave warriors will board this ship. They are skilled combatants who fear no danger.

speaker: Tribios
line: Ooh... I can learn how to fight too and protect everybody!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Silly girl, you're Janusopolis ' Holy Maiden. It's not your duty to fight. There will be many others to protect you.

speaker: Tribios
line: Alright, then where will they come from?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: I believe one warrior hails from a lovely village where bulrushes flourish, while another comes from a magnificent royal city . Though each has their own troubles, both are ready to lend their strength for the ship's long voyage.

speaker: Tribios
line: In that case, let " Trianne " fight by their side!

speaker: Tribios
line: This way, they'll always stay on course!

speaker: Tribbie
line: (How could I have known the name "Trianne" back then?)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Was it just a coincidence, or...)

text: (Approach the doll on the table with the scrolls)

line: Learning can change your destiny!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: When navigating at sea, you need to know both astronomy and geography.

speaker: Tribios
line: Ugh... isn't Janus ' knowledge enough?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Oh, sweetie. The ocean isn't like the land. It's easy to get lost. That's why it's important to learn to recognize the miracle of Aquila .

speaker: Tribios
line: Alright! Even though my brain is already super-duper smart, I'll still try my very best!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Cerces also favors children who try their best. They will send a wise scholar as everyone's teacher to help you reach your dreams.

speaker: Tribios
line: I wanna be a teacher too! Oh, wait, I'm super-duper smart! So I wanna be the teacher's teacher!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Why not? But if you're going to be a teacher, you might need to tone down that hyper energy of yours.

speaker: Tribios
line: Then... " Trinnon " can do it! She's well-behaved and would make a great teacher.

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Mama and the others always said I had a great memory...)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (But now... I can't even tell if this is a memory or a dream...)

text: Activate the music box and listen to mom telling a story

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Come, let's line them up.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Now, Tribios, set them on this music box and let them compose a melody for our song.

speaker: Tribbie
line: M—Music box? What's that?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Sweetheart, are you still groggy from your nap? You invented it!

speaker: Tribbie
line: I... invented it? What does it do?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Oh, my lovely Tribbie, you're usually so bright! What's gotten into you today?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Well, you might as well see for yourself. Put your good friends on it and see the wonders it can do.

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Put the dolls on...)

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's rotating! And I can hear something...

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: That's right! It's a music box. If you place the dolls in the right spots, it will start rotating and play beautiful music...

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: ...Out of all your inventions, this one is my favorite.

speaker: Tribbie
line: I don't... remember...

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: It's alright, my child. I'll sing along to the tune, and it will help jog your memories.

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "Happiness abounded in this lush land by gods chosen. Giants raised their glasses in a toast beheld by the twelve constellations."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "Three carved the heavens and the earth, three wove the threads of fate. Three molded life with their hands, and three guided calamity's gate."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "They declared the world too unstirring, hence wished endless laughter upon the living."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "Thus you and I were created, with words and song to weave, and love and intimacy to give."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "Thus, creation was complete, who then will bear the weight of humanity's souls, to lighten the steps of the living as a whole?"

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "O great Kephale , all-knowing father of stature so tall, yet low does their gaze willingly fall."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "With light of dawn heavy upon their shoulders, golden blood spills unto the land..."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "Converge into a boiling river that flows to the heroic heirs of this world."

speaker: Tribbie
line: Wh—What's going on?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "O Janus █, please lend me your ears █ █!"

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "In the black mist, as death and fate draw close. █n the bloodied earth, the living and dead, but g█o█ts."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "What is this world█ It mirrors your maze-like fa█e. What is this world? A █ilent lament, without a tra██."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "What is the past█ Wandering ghosts that linge█. What is the future? ██uls scattered by fate's f█n██r."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "What is the start█ A voyage born in solitud█. What is the end█ A sp██it, lonely and s█b██e█."

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "Lonely and subdued █nd subdue█ and subdue█ subdue█ subdu██ subdued ██b███d ███d███"

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trianne... Trinnon...!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Mama, what's going on...?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Hurry! █un! █ █ Tribios, █ ██ run! ███ █ ██ █

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: The black tide ██ █ has █ ██ █ arrived █ ██ ███ █ ██!

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Where... can I go?)

speaker: Tribbie
line: What's this...!?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Why...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Why... are there dolls everywhere!?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: This ██ is █ the sacrifice █ ██ of a Holy Maiden.███ █ ██ █

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: You █ won't █ █ make █ ██ it to the end.███ █ ██ █

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Only █ one █ █ person █ ██ can.███ █ █

speaker: Tribbie
line: I know... I know!

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's fine if we can't reach the end... Our minds are made up!

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Go █ █ bid your farewells, Tri ██ █bios███ █ █

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Time ██ █is running█ out.███ ██ █ ██ █ █

speaker: Tribbie
line: Mama... Are you going to leave me?

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: My sweet girl, ██ I █ will never █ leave you.██ ██ █ ██ █ █

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: But remember this, █ █ Tribios...█ ███ ██ █ █

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: "All shall bid farewell to one, and that person alone will witness the miracle —"

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: Since your mind is made up, then traverse the black tide and dispel the fog for Amphoreus...

speaker: Gentle Mother
line: I shall see you tomorrow, my dearest Tribios.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Mama...!

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Are we still in a dream?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Did you have a nightmare?

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Maybe. But it's been a long time since we had any dreams.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's not yet the Entry Hour . You still have plenty of time to rest.

speaker: Tribbie
line: No... Our heart is still racing.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It must be that reckless Kremnoan soldier who startled Trinnon — and you as well. If you want, I can pierce through his chest with the golden thread right now.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy...! Cut it out with the scary talk...

speaker: Aglaea
line: I'm just kidding. If I were serious, I wouldn't have waited until now.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Ah...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Do you want to talk about the dream? Keeping it bottled up is not good for your health.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We ... had a dream about Mama.

speaker: Tribbie
line: The dream itself was nothing... It's just the timing that feels a bit unsettling.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You mean...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...It's Trianne.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Even if we refrain from ever using the power of the Century Gate again... her soul continues to slowly drift away from her body.

speaker: Tribbie
line: There isn't much time left.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Perhaps... it wouldn't be such a bad idea to let her relinquish her role as the "gatekeeper" and live out her days as a carefree child.

speaker: Tribbie
line: You have a point, Agy. But... our decision has already been made on that matter.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I believe there's still another way.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Souls will be spent until they dissolve into dust — such is our fate.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Once, we had a whole and connected body. If that body were a tree, then its trunk and branches would share the same fate, decaying at the same pace.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Now, we are fragmented into numerous selves... Despite the absence of a trunk, we are offered another possibility...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ... We can choose how our branches will perish in a way that is most beneficial to the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Compared with saying farewell to one person... watching many fade away before me is even more sorrowful.

speaker: Tribbie
line: But "advancing" is the destined end of Janus' trial. There's no retreat in our path.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Don't feel sad about saying goodbye to us . We have already agreed on this, right?

speaker: Aglaea
line: It won't be long before I forget what sorrow tastes like.

speaker: Tribbie
line: So, what would you like for breakfast, Agy?

speaker: Aglaea
line: What? Where did that come from...?

speaker: Tribbie
line: After all this talking, we are feeling a bit hungry. Plus, it's nearly the Entry Hour now.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Do you remember when we first met, Agy? You were still a little one, and we caught you secretly eating oatmeal late at night...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Heh, while my emotions might be fading, those memories are still as vivid as ever, teacher.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Please, let me do it. What would you like to eat?

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's fine. Leave it to us . You should rest for now. It won't take long, and we will call you once it's done.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...In that case, thank you.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Then... See you tomorrow, Agy!

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Nevertheless, that nightmare is ominous. Memories are slipping away... even the image of Mama...)

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Just as expected, another trip must be made to the Abyss of Fate . Hopefully, Oronyx will be willing to help us .)

title: Step Description
content: Phainon finds the confined Anaxa, apparently not just for catching up.

text: At the same time, somewhere in Okhema

speaker: Phainon
line: Long time no see, Professor Anaxa.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Who are you?

speaker: Phainon
line: It's been a while. I'm the one who once overthrew the entire classroom in that spiritual physics lecture.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Oh, it's you.

speaker: Phainon
line: No way... Do you really still remember that, professor?

speaker: Anaxa
line: I remember that glib tongue of yours. What brings you here? Surely you're not looking to reminisce.

speaker: Phainon
line: You could tell?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Of course. You only beat around the bush when you have a hidden agenda.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's not true. I'm here to seek enlightenment, as always...

speaker: Phainon
line: Could you please teach me everything you know about the black-robed swordmaster ?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph. Rumors sure travel fast.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Unfortunately I, too, know nothing about it. I can only tell you that it is clad in a black robe and wields a greatsword... At least, it looks like a greatsword. It's shaped like a twisted half-sun...

speaker: Anaxa
line: And a peculiar dagger resembling a crescent moon.

speaker: Anaxa
line: By the way, take this with you—

speaker: Anaxa
line: I got it from the sneak attack. It's yours now.

speaker: Phainon
line: I was right... It is this thing. The one who torched Aedes Elysiae to the ground... and killed everyone.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Don't try to be a hero. No one in Okhema stands a chance against that thing right now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Is that what the Titan said as well?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph, not at first. But the god relented after having had a taste of its power. Even with a god possessing me, I couldn't fight against that blade...

speaker: Anaxa
line: That incredible power doesn't seem to be granted by any Titan.

speaker: Phainon
line: Are you suggesting that... it originates from beyond Amphoreus?

speaker: Anaxa
line: It's possible. Much like the black tide, no?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Nonetheless, it's an enemy we must overcome.

speaker: Anaxa
line: We? Drop the pipe dream, Phainon. No one wants to see you fall by their blade.

speaker: Phainon
line: His mere presence will endanger the holy city and the Flame-Chase.

speaker: Anaxa
line: You know that I don't believe—

speaker: Phainon
line: —You don't believe in the so-called prophecy. I know. However, I'm here to seek your assistance, not at the request of Aglaea or Tribbie...

speaker: Phainon
line: I just want to eliminate a threat to the city I pledged to protect. That's all. The tragedy at the Grove must never happen again.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Take a seat. Since you are sincerely seeking enlightenment...

speaker: Anaxa
line: I suppose I can tell you one more thing.

text: Have an audience with Oronyx and regain memories

title: Step Description
content: To replicate memories and fulfill the promise toKrateros,wequietly visit the Abyss of Fate, searching for objects that have witnessed those years.

text: Soon after, in the Abyss of Fate

speaker: Trianne
line: Mmm...

speaker: Tribbie
line: What's wrong, Trianne?

speaker: Trianne
line: Nothing! Just... remembering what happened at the Grove.

speaker: Trianne
line: Monster in the black cloak, so scary. Everyone, in danger... Nightmare, can't forget.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Don't be scared... There are no bad guys here. Didn't you save everyone with the Century Gate, Trianne?

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne threw it away. Far, far away. It's never coming back.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We got back safe from the Grove because of you, Trianne. You're the reason the Flame-Chase Journey can continue.

speaker: Trianne
line: Sorry, Trianne feels... a bit dizzy. Why are we here again?

speaker: Tribbie
line: For the same thing, of course. Remember? Tomorrow, we will reveal the prophecy's past to everyone.

speaker: Tribbie
line: But first, we need to restore the memories that have been blurred by the fragmentation. We hope to present the full truth to everyone, without hiding anything.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Since Janus caused the fragmentation, we can only turn to another Titan, Oronyx , for help.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Also... remember to get breakfast ready for Agy before the Lucid Hour tomorrow!

speaker: Trianne
line: Ah, yes! Trianne remembers now!

speaker: Trinnon
line: Oh, on that note... we had better prepare some "saffron" before we meet with the Titan.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Saffron? Ah, it's an essential offering for rituals in the Temple of the Three Fates. You think we shouldn't go to Oronyx empty-handed?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Yes. It's also a symbol of Janusopolis. If we are to replicate memories, we need to use something that has experienced those days...

speaker: Trinnon
line: And when we first met Agy, we added that to the porridge we made for her, and she really loved it!

speaker: Trianne
line: I see! It's like killing three birds with one stone!

speaker: Trinnon
line: But... it all depends on whether Oronyx is willing to help us .

speaker: Tribbie
line: This... could be a problem.

speaker: Trinnon
line: After all, it was us who took the Coreflame from Janus ... From Oronyx's kin.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We will have to give it a try. If there is truly no other way...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...In our current state, we probably can't do anything to them. We* ll cross that bridge when we get there...

speaker: Trianne
line: Leave it to Trianne. Trianne knows how to play cute!

speaker: Tribbie
line: In any case, let's look for saffron first. I hope there's still some left in the temple, untouched by Nikador's soldiers.

speaker: Tribbie
line: I remember that aged saffron is preserved in sealed jars...

text: Find "saffron" and have an audience with Oronyx

speaker: Tribbie
line: Let's be on the lookout as we go.

speaker: Aglaea
line: "It's a dead end ahead — turn back, teacher."

speaker: Tribbie
line: What, Agy? No, it's an illusion!

speaker: Trianne
line: Wow! This room is huge!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trinnon, did you...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Yeah, I saw it. Was that... a warning from Oronyx ?

speaker: Trianne
line: What are you two whispering about, Tribbie? Trinnon?

speaker: Tribbie
line: (Trianne can't even hear our own telecommunication?)

speaker: Trianne
line: Well, never mind. Trianne suddenly feels like this place is quite familiar!

speaker: Trianne
line: There's a whiff of "safari" in this room. It's... right over there!

speaker: Trianne
line: Over here! Follow Trianne—

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trianne... Slow down...

speaker: Mydei
line: "Even if separation is our fate, a futile death is not the solution."

speaker: Tribbie
line: It appeared again...

speaker: Trianne
line: Right here! "I summon thee, Oronyx! Stir up ripples of past reverie!"

speaker: Trianne
line: ...Something's appeared!

speaker: Trinnon
line: Wait, we should read it first...

children.speaker: To Mr. Wincolm
children.line: ... For many years, Janusopolis has relied on the rose myrtle to obtain the boon of the gods. We have spent five or six years now digging out its roots and cutting back its branches. Now, this red tree is on the verge of collapse and has long since ceased to serve its purpose, yet it still seeks to spread out its canopy and eclipse Janusopolis from the glorious rays. We have a secret plan to fell this tree. We just need to wait for the ceremony to make a small move, and the rose myrtle will slip and fall into the abyss... Janusopolis is built on a mountainside — there are more than a few cases of people who have lost their footing in its history. ... As for the next sacred tree, we were planning on selecting another puppet. As for the rose myrtle's daughter, Tribios... We'll call her saffron for now. In my eyes, I think it would be fine to just find an excuse to off saffron. However, Codex the acolyte is extremely insistent on raising her to become the next sacred tree. She has undergone related education since she was a young girl, which would save a lot of work on our part. As for her identity as the daughter of rose myrtle... She is still young and has not yet grown wings. If we can just keep her grounded, the power of the divine oracle will remain tightly in our grasp. We both know that the saffron's most outstanding property is that it can be cooked in so many ways: Put in porridge, stewed, or fried... No matter how you cook it, this plant will always be a delicacy. ... Dannalio

speaker: Trinnon
line: Wait, this is... a letter? It mentions something about "saffron" and... "Tribios"?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Isn't that name...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Never mind that for now. Why is this letter here? And how did Trianne sense it?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Could it be... our lost memories?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Is it possible that we were already noticed by Oronyx and entered their trial?

speaker: Tribbie
line: But why haven't they said a word?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Oronyx has the whims of a child. Perhaps... they're toying with us on purpose.

text: Continue following Trianne and look for "saffron"

speaker: Tribbie
line: Come on... This isn't the right time to be playing games.

text: (Approach Trianne at the bottom of the bridge)

speaker: Castorice
line: "Separation and death are two sides of the same coin..."

speaker: Castorice
line: "Reconciliation doesn't come easily for a mortal."

speaker: Tribbie
line: Are these visions also fragments of the past?

speaker: Trianne
line: Tribbie! Trinnon! Look what I found! Is this the "safari"?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Coming! We* ll take a look...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...But Trianne, there's nothing in here.

speaker: Trianne
line: What? It was right in this dolium...

speaker: Trianne
line: Huh? There's really nothing here? That can't be! I swear I saw it...

speaker: Trianne
line: I swear! Trianne is telling the truth! It was right there — where did it go?

speaker: Trianne
line: Trinnon, Tribbie, why aren't you saying anything? Trianne can't seem to hear you at all...

speaker: Trinnon
line: ... We were just lost in our thoughts. Don't worry, Trianne.

speaker: Trinnon
line: What you saw was likely a Janus hare. We must have startled it away.

speaker: Trianne
line: ...Okay.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Could Oronyx be trying to make us falter? But why would they do that?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Something feels off... Tribbie, don't you think the temple is a little too quiet?

speaker: Tribbie
line: What do you mean?

speaker: Trinnon
line: It might just be an illusion, but Trinnon wonders...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Is Oronyx ... really putting us through a trial?

text: Have an audience with Oronyx and try to convince them

speaker: Trianne
line: Ugh, still no luck finding any "safari"...

speaker: Tribbie
line: I suppose we can do without it... Let's try to convince Oronyx .

speaker: Tribbie
line: At least they didn't toss us out straight away.

speaker: Trianne
line: Wow! Tribbie! Trinnon! Look at this! So cool!

speaker: Trianne
line: There are... so many of us now!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trianne...

speaker: Trianne
line: It's really quiet in here! Do all Titans live in dark places like this?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Wh—What's going on?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Oronyx ... disappeared?

text: Keep observing Phainon conversing with Anaxa

title: Step Description
content: Phainon finds the confined Anaxa, apparently not just for catching up.

speaker: Phainon
line: Are you saying that the black-robed swordmaster is not just tied to the black tide... but is also hunting for Coreflames everywhere?

speaker: Anaxa
line: This is the most plausible possibility. First, it has a vessel that can hold Coreflames. Second, I'm one of its targets.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Let's start with the first premise. Its peculiar "ceremonial blade" can interact with the Coreflame, as evidenced by the pull I felt when it stabbed into my chest. I hypothesize that the blade can sense, absorb... or even retain Coreflames.

speaker: Anaxa
line: The second premise is even more explicit. When it was engaged in fierce battle with many of us and was heavily distracted, it remained consistently focused on me — or rather, on the Titan Cerces inside me.

speaker: Phainon
line: Heh, so it's plundering the flames...

speaker: Phainon
line: But if your argument holds up, wouldn't he be headed to Okhema soon? The Vortex of Genesis is full of the Titans' Coreflames.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Not necessarily. Let's call that person the "Flame Reaver" for now. If my presumption holds, that person has three targets.

speaker: Anaxa
line: The first target is me. The second target is Oronyx , who hasn't yet fallen. And the third is Okhema and the Vortex of Genesis, where the Coreflames are housed.

speaker: Anaxa
line: But I suspect Okhema won't be their first target. Kephale 's Coreflame is guarded by the Council of Elders ' arcane power, and Phagousa 's water curtain should be able to block out any external perceptions.

speaker: Phainon
line: What about Thanatos and Aquila ? Their Coreflames are yet to be restored...

speaker: Anaxa
line: The whereabouts of Thanatos remain a mystery to all. As for Aquila ...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Can you fly?

speaker: Phainon
line: No, I can't. Why are you asking that?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Can that swordmaster fly?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Ah, good point. But what if he does grow wings...

speaker: Anaxa
line: If they had wings, I wouldn't have made it out of the Grove alive.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's a relief. Anyway, since the Flame Reaver has two targets, we need to move fast...

speaker: Anaxa
line: With the distances between Okhema, the Grove, and these potential targets, I believe we should bolster our defense in...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Bad news, Phainon—

speaker: Dan Heng
line: — Tribbie is missing! The last time the three of them were seen was in...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Abyss of Fate !

title: Step Description
content: To replicate memories and fulfill the promise to Krateros,wequietly visit the Abyss of Fate, searching for objects that have witnessed those years.

speaker: Trianne
line: Oronyx —

speaker: Trianne
line: Are you in here —?

speaker: Trinnon
line: No response at all...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Did they foresee that we were coming and hide in the fog? Or...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Tribbie... We should leave. This temple...

speaker: Trinnon
line: ...Has other people in it.

speaker: Tribbie
line: What!?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Listen — footsteps, fast ones. Three or four people, coming this way.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Come on, we need to hide! Whoever they are, we can't let them see us !

speaker: Trianne
line: Tribbie, Trinnon... Come check this out.

speaker: Trianne
line: What's this?

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne feels like... it's so familiar.

speaker: Trianne
line: Fly!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trianne?

speaker: Trianne
line: Tribbie...

speaker: Trianne
line: See you tomorrow.

text: Some time later, in Abyss of Fate

speaker: Tribbie
line: Ugh...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Where am I...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Little Gray? Snowy? And...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Wait... where's Trianne? Is she back?

speaker: Phainon
line: We only saw the two of you collapsed on the side of the road when we arrived...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Dannie and I looked around, but we couldn't find any traces of Lady Trianne...

speaker: Trinnon
line: What about the black-robed swordmaster?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Blast it! Of course it's him!

speaker: Phainon
line: We were still too late. I fear something bad has happened to Oronyx's Coreflame.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Then, Lady Trianne...

speaker: Tribbie
line: She doesn't have much divine power left. We can barely sense anything...

text: We need to go after that black-robed swordmaster.
Trianne... I have a bad feeling about this.

speaker: Phainon
line: That you're both safe is already a blessing.

speaker: Phainon
line: Everyone, we must take action now. We should split into two groups: One group will stay in the Abyss and meet up with Aglaea's reinforcements, then search for Trianne's whereabouts.

speaker: Phainon
line: The other group will come with me to pursue the black-robed swordmaster and recover the Coreflame.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Do you know where it's headed?

speaker: Phainon
line: I didn't get to tell you this before, but Anaxa and I already have our misgivings about the black tide, so we've made preparations.

speaker: Phainon
line: I'll tell you the details as we move. Opportunities are fleeting on the battlefield. We should hurry.

speaker: Okhema Scout
line: Lord Phainon! Ah... Lady Tribbie! And Lady Trinnon! I'm glad you're alright!

speaker: Phainon
line: Did Aglaea's people get here?

speaker: Okhema Scout
line: Yes! Lady Aglaea already knows about the situation and sent along a message.

speaker: Okhema Scout
line: "Phainon, I understand that swordmaster is of great importance to you, but if you charge in without a plan, I fear that... you won't be the only one who dies in vain."

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I understand. "Hatred is a hero's deadliest poison." I have no intention of fighting alone. If that swordmaster really is related to the black tide, the Chrysos Heirs must not take them lightly.

speaker: Phainon
line: I have indeed planned to return to the holy city and discuss the strategy with Aglaea. We'll need all the help we can get for this encirclement.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Why don't we split up as previously discussed? Hyacine and I will stay to regroup with the reinforcements. You go back to the holy city with everyone else and tell Aglaea about your plan.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Trinnon will stay in the Abyss, too. That way, both sides can communicate with each other if anything happens.

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ Thank you, everyone. ( Trailblazer ), Tribbie, let's go.

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
